Hospital & Medical Facility Coverage

Hospital Mobile Notary Service — Los Angeles & Ventura County

We bring mobile notary services directly to hospital bedsides across the San Fernando Valley, Santa Clarita, Ventura County, Hollywood, and greater Los Angeles. Whether you need a power of attorney, healthcare directive, or other documents notarized during a hospital stay, we come to you with everything needed — including a laptop and portable printer to generate documents on-site.

Call/Text (213) 933-2507 Book Hospital Visit
How hospital notary visits work

Simple, fast, bedside service

When you or a family member needs documents notarized at a hospital, you should not have to leave the bedside or wait days for an appointment. Here is how it works:

  1. Contact us by phone, text, or online booking. Let us know the hospital, patient name, room number, and the documents you need notarized.
  2. We confirm details — timing, documents, and whether you need our laptop and printer to generate forms on-site.
  3. We come to you — we arrive at the hospital, check in with security or the front desk, and meet you at the bedside or a quiet family area.
  4. We notarize — the signing is completed calmly and efficiently, with full respect for the medical team and the patient's comfort.

For urgent situations, call or text (213) 933-2507 directly so we can prioritize your request and confirm the fastest available time.

Hospital visit pricing

Tier-based pricing by location

Hospital visit pricing is based on distance from our Granada Hills base. Tier 1 covers nearby San Fernando Valley and Santa Clarita hospitals. Tier 2 covers facilities that require additional travel time through heavier traffic corridors.

Service Tier 1 (Nearby) Tier 2 (Extended)
Standard hospital visit (your documents) $195 $225
Hospital visit with laptop & printer (includes 1 document) $245 $275
Each additional generated document +$50 +$50

For full pricing details and non-hospital services, see our pricing page.

What we notarize at hospitals

Common hospital documents

  • Advance healthcare directives and living wills
  • Medical and durable powers of attorney
  • HIPAA authorization and medical records release forms
  • Wills, trust documents, and related estate forms
  • Financial powers of attorney
  • Insurance, benefits, and pension forms requiring notarization
  • Facility admission, transfer, or discharge paperwork

Not sure if your document needs notarization? Text us a clear photo and we will check the notary section for you before the appointment.

On-site document generation

Laptop and portable printer at any hospital

If you need a power of attorney, healthcare directive, or other form but do not have it ready, you can use my equipment and Rocket Lawyer access to create the document during our appointment. This service includes use of my laptop, portable printer, internet connection, and platform access. You choose which documents to create; I provide the hardware and administrative help to get the paperwork ready.

Important: I am a commissioned notary public, not an attorney. I do not provide legal advice, recommend specific documents, or explain your legal rights. Any help I provide with Rocket Lawyer or similar services is strictly administrative — using my laptop, printer, internet connection, and platform access to help you generate, print, and organize the forms you choose so they are ready to sign and notarize. For legal questions or to decide which documents are appropriate for your situation, please consult a licensed attorney.
Don't see your hospital?

We cover more facilities than listed here

This page highlights the hospitals we visit most frequently, but we are not limited to this list. We also serve skilled nursing facilities, rehabilitation centers, assisted living communities, and other medical facilities throughout Los Angeles and Ventura County. If your hospital or facility is not shown above — including locations in downtown Los Angeles, Glendale, Pasadena, Santa Monica, or Ventura — call or text us at (213) 933-2507 and we will confirm coverage, travel time, and pricing for your specific location.

Schedule a hospital visit

Book a mobile notary at your hospital

To schedule a mobile notary at any hospital or medical facility, call or text us at (213) 933-2507, or request an appointment online. If your situation is urgent, let us know it is a hospital signing so we can prioritize your call and confirm the fastest available time.
